programme.title: Tiny House Nation
programme.desc: A Vermont family builds 493 sq. foot Tiny House in their driveway, but they need a home that will work for 3 adults.

programme.title: Tiny House Nation
programme.sub-title: 330 Sq. Ft. Ever Growing Tiny House
programme.desc: Ashleigh and Cody are a young eclectic couple with two very different design styles excited to build their first home together that can hopefully mesh his love for modern, clean lines with her funky bohemian style.

programme.title: Tiny House Nation
programme.desc: John and Zack head to Arkansas farm country to help a couple who have been living on the road turn a school bus into a tiny home where they can settle down.

programme.title: Tiny House Nation
programme.sub-title: Size Doesn't Matter: The Best of Tiny Houses
programme.desc: John Weisbarth, celebrates the most awe-inspiring solutions in tiny living; from an eco-friendly studio to a refurbished silo; proof that size doesn't matter.

programme.title: Zombie House Flipping
programme.desc: The team gets recruited by an overwhelmed homeowner for a flip on a lakefront property; although the potential profit is huge, the outdated layout and termite damage make this dusty time capsule a midcentury mishap.

programme.title: Zombie House Flipping
programme.desc: Duke locates a dilapidated mid-century modern home with botched restoration work that will need to be redone; After Justin decides to run the project on his own, he soon realizes that he may have bitten off more than he can chew.

programme.title: Zombie House Flipping
programme.desc: Chauncey turns the tables on Derek by buying a tiny house in the middle of nowhere, sight unseen and without consulting him first.

programme.title: Zombie House Flipping
programme.desc: The team takes on the renovation of a 100-year-old house in hopes of having a showpiece flip as well as a sweet profit; termite damage, outdated electrical systems, and hard-to-match vintage details could turn the showpiece into a public disaster.

programme.title: Zombie House Flipping
programme.desc: The team finds a midcentury house that has its share of zombie features, but also some vintage touches that Ashlee thinks can be restored; when Keith insists that everything be updated, it becomes a battle of classic-retro versus modern upgrades.

programme.title: Zombie House Flipping
programme.desc: The zombie flippers uncover a flag lot property -- a house tucked behind another with a narrow access; there's a property line dispute with the neighbor, but the lakefront location and low price are too tantalizing to pass up.

programme.title: Zombie House Flipping
programme.desc: Dolmar gets a great deal on a zombie in the up-and-coming Spring Hill neighborhood, but after a series of mistakes and expensive renovations this money maker quickly starts to look more like a money pit.
